!PatchTestLocation.description:
36 Lessons of Vivec, Sermon 1 Title 36 Lessons of Vivec, Sermon 1 Full Title The 36 Lessons of Vivec, Sermon One Author FormID BookSkill_Athletics3

36 Lessons of Vivec, Sermon 1 is a The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind.

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Contents
  • 3 Trivia
  • 4 Appearances

Locations

  • Falas Ancestral Tomb
  • Vasesius Viciulus: Trader

Contents

He was born in the ash among the Boethiah, who was the Prince of Plots, and things unknown and known would fold themselves around her until they were like stars or the messages of stars. Ayem took a netchiman's wife and said:

'I am the Face-Snaked Queen of the VEHK, which you will repeat to it until mystery comes.'

Then Ayem threw the netchiman's wife into the ocean water where dreughs took her into castles of glass and coral. They gifted the netchiman's wife with gills and milk fingers, changing her sex so that she might give birth to the image as an egg. There she stayed for seven or eight months.

Then Seht came to the netchiman's wife and said:

'I am the Clockwork King of the Three in One. In you is an egg of my brother-sister, who possesses invisible knowledge of words and swords, which you shall nurture until the Hortator comes.'

And Seht then extended his hands and multitudes of homunculi came forth, each like a glimmering rope through the water, and they raised the netchiman's wife back to the surface world and set her down on the shoals of Trinimac.

Seven Fa-Nuit-Hen, or the Multiplier of Motions Known. And Fa-Nuit-Hen said:

'Whom do you wait for?'

To which the netchiman's wife said to the Hortator.

'Go to the land of the Indoril in three months' time, for that is when war comes. I return now to haunt the warriors who fell and still wonder why. But first I show you this.'

Then the Barons and the Demiprince joined together into a pillar of fighting styles terrible to behold and they danced before the egg and its learning image.

'Look, little Vehk, and find the face behind the splendor of my bladed carriage, for in it is delivered the unmixed conflict path, perfect in every way. What is its number?'

It is said the number is the number of birds that can nest in an ancient tibrol tree, less three grams of honest work, but Vivec in his later years found a better one and so gave this secret to his people.

'For I have crushed a world with my left hand,' he will say, 'but in my right hand is how it could have won against me. Love is under my will only.'

The ending of the words is ALMSIVI.

Trivia

  • In The Elder Scrolls Online the book is titled The 36 Lessons: Sermon 1.

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
  • The Elder Scrolls Online: Morrowind

Abaelun Mine.description:
Abaelun Mine Map World map Local map Interior map Region Caldera.

The mine is run as a combined effort by the House Hlaalu. The mine is guarded by two Imperial Guards, and is worked by four Dunmer miners.

Other than the rich stash of 20 diamonds in seven deposits, (some of which are hard to see or behind rocks), this rather small mine is unremarkable.

Addadshashanammu, Shrine.description:
Addadshashanammu Map World map Local map Exterior map Interior map Region Daedric Ruin Characters Worshipers Location ID Addadshashanammu, Shrine

Addadshashanammu is a Gnaar Mok, with its entrance facing northwest to the sea.

A relatively large shrine, this ruin is occupied by five hostile people and one Holmgeira.

The loot includes several scrolls, some soul gems, and two skill books as well as some alchemy apparatuses. The pearl on the altar is cursed.

One of the people inside the shrine, calmed first.

If the Seyda Neen, she might ask that something be done about the smugglers there. All of the smugglers in the cave are hostile, and will attack on sight.

Gallery

Trivia

  • There is a hidden chamber in the cave that can be reached along two routes: by entering the gate at the back of the inner chamber and swimming through the water, or by traversing the rocky ledge immediately to the left when looking out from the slaves' pen. There is a cave rat and the bones of a corpse in this chamber. There is some armor, including a thief ring near the ribcage, Pass through the submerged tunnel to emerge in a chamber with a rusted chest to the left containing a few drakes and random loot.
  • There is a fair amount of skooma in the smugglers' loot.
  • The three slaves freed in this cave count toward the twenty slaves needed to receive the code phrase and unlock the "Ilmeni Dren.
  • There are two keys that will allow the player to open the slaves' bracers and the locked gates in this cave. One can be found on Tanisie Verethi, the other on a crate next to the water on the northern side of the cave.

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind

Ald Daedroth.description:
Ald Daedroth Map World map Local map Outer shrine Inner shrine Left Wing Right Wing Antechamber Region Daedric Shrine Sublocations See below Quests See below Characters See below Location ID Ald Daedroth, Outer ShrineAld Daedroth, AntechamberAld Daedroth, Left WingAld Daedroth, Right WingAld Daedroth, Inner Shrine

Ald Daedroth is a The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind.

  • 1 Description 1.1 The Ordinators and the Cultists
  • 2 Sublocations 2.1 Outer Shrine 2.2 Left Wing 2.3 Right Wing 2.4 Inner Shrine 2.5 Antechamber
  • 3 Quests
  • 4 Notable items
  • 5 Characters 5.1 Outside 5.2 Outer Shrine 5.3 Inner Shrine 5.4 Left Wing 5.5 Right Wing 5.6 Antechamber
  • 6 Creatures
  • 7 Gallery
  • 8 Trivia
  • 9 Appearances

Description

It is located on the easternmost island of the Ordinators and some Sheogorath cultists.

The Ordinators and the Cultists

Outside, on either side of the ruin stands Lustidrike can be found there.

Hlireni Indavel, who is the leader of the Cultists, will ask the Nerevarine, referring to which side they chose, whether they are a "Spectator," simply watching the fighting; a "Game Piece," joining the fight; or a "Player of the Game," challenging her personally to a duel. While Hlireni does not seem bothered by whose side the Hero is on, she refers to the Golden Saints by remarking, "the ones in the gold masks are party crashers, but all are welcome to the Mad God's Masque and Bellicose Ball."

Sublocations

The overall plan of the shrine is three parallel lines. The Outer Shrine, the Inner Shrine and the Antechamber form a straight line in the center, with the Right and Left Wings flanking and connecting the Outer Shrine and Inner Shrine.

Outer Shrine

The outer shrine, is the first accessible room inside the ruins.

Left Wing

This area is made of two large rooms adjoined by corridor. One room contains a large statue of Azura, and the other, a statue of Malacath.

Right Wing

This area is made of two large rooms adjoined by corridor. One room contains a large statue of Molag Bal and the other, a statue of Mehrunes Dagon.

Inner Shrine

This area is one large room, with a door on each four sides leading to the other sections of the ruin. A large statue Sheogorath stands in the middle of the room.

Antechamber

It is three large rooms with a corridor adjoining this section to the rest of the ruin. This is where Hlireni Indavel and Lustidrike can be found.

  • Ahemmusa Nerevarine
  • Sheogorath of the House of Troubles

  • Depending on the level of the Nerevarine, and if they do not interfere with the battles throughout the ruin, and only observes, the outcome of the battles differ (due to the cultists having leveled weapons). At low level, the Ordinators will defeat all the Cultists. At higher level, some cultists will match the Ordinators and defeat them.

Ald Redaynia.description:
Ald Redaynia Map World map Local map Interior map Region Sheogorad Location ID ald redaynia

Ald Redaynia is a location in Vvardenfell.

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Quests 2.1 The Bitter Cup
  • 3 Notable items
  • 4 Enemies
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 Appearances

Description

Upon entering the ruins, the Nerevarine will be in a hallway, with a trapped door to the left and a trapped door with a level 75 lock on the right. The door to the left leads to a room with a dead body. The door to the right leads to a large tomb with several undead enemies, and a stairway at the other end of the room. Up the stairway is the Vampiric Ring.

Straight ahead from the entrance, there is a dead end with a passage to the left. This passage leads to a flooded basement that contains two slaughterfish and a submerged dead body. On the other side of the room, there is a hallway containing several undead creatures and a few containers. On top of these containers are several thieves' tools and the key that unlocks the chest in the basement.

Quests

The Bitter Cup

Find an artifact to help sway Camonna Tong.

Notable items

  • Skill Book) (in chest)
  • Bittercup
  • Chest Key (on containers behind dead skeleton) Unlocks the chest in the basement.
  • Scroll of Warrior's Blessing (in chest)
  • Scroll of Drathis' Soulrot (in chest)
  • Silver Staff of War (on War Wizard)
  • Vampiric Ring (on War Wizard)

Enemies

  • undead (x6)
  • Skeleton War-Wizard (base ID skeleton_aldredaynia)
  • Slaughterfish (x2)

Trivia

  • Ald Redaynia is mentioned in both The Cake and the Diamond.

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
  • The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (mentioned only)
  • The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim (mentioned only)

Ald Skar Inn.description:
Ald Skar Inn Map Local Map Top Level Rear Basement Region ShashevSkeetulTuundir Location ID "Ald-ruhn, Ald Skar Inn"

Ald Skar Inn is an Ald'ruhn. It is commonly thought to be the most respectable inn in Ald'ruhn[1] and is owned by Boderi Farano.

  • 1 Sublocations
  • 2 Quests 2.1 Main Quest 2.2 House Redoran 2.3 Vampiric 2.4 Miscellaneous
  • 3 Notable items
  • 4 Characters
  • 5 Appearances

Sublocations

The Inn consists of three unnamed floors:

  • The top floor. This is where the bar is and is accessible directly up the stairs from the front door.
  • The rear basement. This is where Zainsubani, Laelippe and Tuundir are and is accessible from a stair going down from the top floor.
  • The front basement. This is where several characters and a six bedrooms are. It is accessible directly down the stairs from the front door.

Note that the two basements are not connected.

Ashlanders and the Nerevarine Cult.

Ald Sotha.description:
Ald Sotha Destroyed Dark Brotherhood

Ald Sotha is a ruined city located amidst the Clockwork City.

  • 1 By game
  • 2 Geography
  • 3 History 3.1 First Era 3.2 Second Era 3.3 Third Era
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Appearances
  • 6 References

By game

  • Ald Sotha (Morrowind)
  • Ald Sotha (Online)

Geography

Ald Sotha is situated northeast of the floating city of Sheogorad.

History

First Era

Ald Sotha was a minor settlement amidst the grazelands of southern Vvardenfell, where several settlements including Indoril Nerevar. As time went on, Sotha Sil would attain godhood and become a member of the Tribunal, along with Vivec and Almalexia. He would establish the Clockwork City, a world incredibly advanced, filled with machines and factotums.[1][2]

Second Era

During the Vivec City.[3][4]

Third Era

During the Shoes of St. Rilms were located here, near the statue to Mehrunes Dagon.[5][6][7]

Ald-ruhn.description:
Ald'ruhn Constructed Circa Red Exiles

Ald'ruhn (Ashlanders.

  • 1 By game
  • 2 Geography
  • 3 History 3.1 First Era 3.1.1 The Battle against Skar; the Ashlander's Ald'ruhn 3.2 Second Era 3.2.1 Ancestral Ties to Ald'ruhn; Enter Drelyth Hleran 3.2.2 The False Nerevarine; Conoon Chodala of Urshilaku 3.3 Third Era 3.3.1 Old Run during the Imperial Simulacrum 3.3.2 The True Nerevarine; Duel against Bolvyn Venim 3.3.3 Remember Redoran; the Fall of Ald'ruhn 3.4 Fourth Era 3.4.1 The Red Year & Raven Rock
  • 4 Sociology 4.1 Traditions
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Appearances
  • 7 References

By game

  • Old Run (Arena)
  • Ald'ruhn (Morrowind)
  • Ald'ruhn (Online)

Geography

The original Ashlander camp called Ald'ruhn was vast, occupying the hills in between the Ashlands of House Redoran had begun to inhabit the area, establishing the Great City of Ald'ruhn. Skar was refurbished as the Manor District of the town, and the yurts were replaced with the traditional Redoran homes. The new residents of Ald'ruhn created walls surrounding the city, protecting the city from the ash storms of the region.

The former campsite was remade as the town square of the Ald'ruhn city, and the rest of the city revolves around this area. The road leading into the Ald'ruhn Manor District has several artisan services ranging from the libraries or the blacksmiths of House Redoran. The entrance of Ald'ruhn has twin watchtowers overlooking the area, and it leads to the southern town square, with the local Tribunal Temple. North of the temple is a private estate to the nobles of House Redoran.

History

First Era

The Battle against Skar; the Ashlander's Ald'ruhn

The sub-continent of Vvardenfell and overall Morrowind has housed all sorts of alien creatures, varying in sizes. The Calderas, which became a legend afterward. The carcass of Skar was refurbished as a meeting place for the Ashlanders of Vvardenfell, should anything affect their home, they can convene in the newly-established settlement named Ald'ruhn.[4][5]

Second Era

Ancestral Ties to Ald'ruhn; Enter Drelyth Hleran

During the Hleran Ancestral Tomb, where they communed with the spirit of Dranoth Hleran. After proving their pure intent, Dranoth bestowed the Vestige with the legendary spear named Calderas. The traveler than gave Drelyth the spear and with the weapon, the Ashlanders trusted the Hleran Elf, and other Dark Elves of Vvardenfell began to commune with the local Ashlanders. This event was the beginning of the Great City of Ald'ruhn.[6]

The False Nerevarine; Conoon Chodala of Urshilaku

Around the same time, Barilzar.[7][8][9]

Third Era

Old Run during the Imperial Simulacrum

During the Imperial Palace. The Eternal Champion had at one point visited the town of Old Run in their quest to recover the pieces.[10]

The True Nerevarine; Duel against Bolvyn Venim

During the Vivec and dueled each other, with the Nerevarine claiming victory. After convincing the other Councilors, the warrior was named the Hortator of the Great House Redoran, being one step closer to fulfilling the prophecy.[11]

Remember Redoran; the Fall of Ald'ruhn

During the Oblivion Crisis in Imperial City.[12][UL 1]

Fourth Era

The Red Year & Raven Rock

In Mournhold, a House Redoran had undergone a relief effort to rebuild the settlements of Vvardenfell including Ald'ruhn. It is unknown if it was completely rebuilt.[13][14][15]

Sociology

Traditions

Click to show
The Evening Star. It is a day of rest, where many leave the events of the passing year behind and to reflect their past. They rest for the New Life Festival.[16]
Click to show
The Vivec, being dubbed Saint Jiub the Eradicator.[17][18]

Gallery

Recover Shields from Andasreth

This Redoran Banner Shields. The shields can be found on the lower level in the locked room with the four dead guards.

Propylon Chamber

Andasreth has a Propylon Chamber linking to Berandas.

Lower Level

The lower level consists of a hallway running around the perimeter, with four rooms. Two rooms, behind wooden doors with one guard each, are set up as living quarters with hammocks, chests, and various furniture. The room behind the wooden door with a level 20 lock has the body of four Redoran guards. The remaining room contains two bandits and several crates, and a door leading to the upper level.

Arrow.description:
It has been suggested that this article or section be moved to Arrows. (Discuss)

An arrow is a long, thin bow-fired projectile. At the tip is an arrowhead made of some hard material. The shaft is the long 'stick' part of the arrow, and is usually comprised of wood or an alloy. The tail end features fletching to provide accuracy and stability in flight, typically poultry feathers. Dwarven, Dremora, and Daedric arrows have an alloy fletching. There is also the nock at the end, which is secured onto the bow string. In The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind, there are alternative forms of projectiles, including throwing stars and crossbow bolts.

  • 1 By game
  • 2 Properties
  • 3 Bound weaponry
  • 4 Acquisition
  • 5 By type

By game

  • Arrows (Daggerfall)
  • Arrows (Morrowind)
  • Arrows (Oblivion)
  • Arrows (Skyrim)

Properties

Arrows are required for damage dealing with a bow and cannot be fired underwater. Arrows can become lodged in the player character or in physical surfaces. Fired arrows can be collected, although they cannot always be collected when they are stuck in corpses.

Followers can be given arrows to fire with their bows, however, when their arrow supply has depleted, they revert to iron arrows and have an infinite supply.

In The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, arrows can be enchanted with spells after gaining access to the Arcane University. Arrows imbued with magical enchantments can also be found as randomized loot.

Bound weaponry

Bound Bows come outfitted with Bound Arrows. These arrows cannot be collected when dropped. They appear the same as Daedric Arrows. In The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, any type of arrow can be fired with a Bound Bow; however, Bound Arrows are the default.

Acquisition

  • Arrows are typically sold by Blacksmiths, weapons vendors, and general traders.
  • Foes that wield bows typically carry arrows in their inventory.
  • As of the Dawnguard add-on, players can now craft their own arrows with firewood and 1 Steel Ingot will create 24 steel arrows.

By type

Arranged by damage magnitude:

  • Bound Arrow
  • Iron Arrow
  • Steel Arrow
  • Dwarven Arrow
  • Elven Arrow
  • Glass Arrow
  • Ebony Arrow
  • Dremora Arrow
  • Daedric Arrow
  • Dragonbone Arrow DG

Arvs-Drelen.description:
Arvs-Drelen Map Region West Gash Type Velothi Tower Location ID "Gnisis, Arvs-Drelen"

Arvs-Drelen is a can be found within it.
  • 1 Layout 1.1 Lowest floor 1.2 Ground floor 1.3 First and second floor
  • 2 Quests 2.1 Rescue Ragash gra-Shuzgub 2.2 Master Index (Plug-in)
  • 3 Characters
  • 4 Creatures
  • 5 Notable items
  • 6 Appearances
  • 7 References

Layout

Arvs-Drelen serves as the domicile of Baladas Demnevanni. It possesses four different floors and an entresol, where the entrance is.

Lowest floor

The lowest floor contains one room, which serves as a prison and storeroom. The prison is equipped for up to three prisoners. The lock to the cell is level 65 and trapped, thus not easy to overcome. During the quest "Orsimer is held captive here.

Ground floor

The next level houses three rooms. The one closest to the cell is a bedroom for a group of people, containing four beds. For whom this room is designed is unclear. However, it does not belong to Baladas, the only humanoid resident, as there is a much more richly endowed bedroom on the topmost floor where he resides. Here, the Nerevarine can find the key for a door that leads to this upper level.

The other two rooms on this level are placed opposite to each other. One is another bedroom, larger than the first one, with only one bed, but having a feeling of neglect and abandonment about it, being almost empty. In the other room, several valuable items are stored in various containers, some of them locked up and trapped. They are guarded by two skeletons.

First and second floor

These two levels consist of two large, circular rooms on top of each other, that are connected through two curved staircases. This part of the tower is accessed through a door with a level 50 lock and a trap. There is, however, a key to this door in a chamber on the ground floor, as described above.

The lower of the two rooms is nicely decorated but without any notable furniture apart from a small table and a chair in a corner. Tapestries and potted plants embellish the room, where also the pet Daedroth of Baladas Demnevanni lumbers.

The upper room is the most richly equipped in the whole building. It lies directly under the dome-shaped roof of the tower and seems to serve as the living quarters of Baladas Demnevanni, who resides here. Baladas also keeps his shock centurion here, possibly as additional protection of his already heavily guarded home. He owns a whole set of Master's alchemist tools. Many partly rare and valuable potions also stand on two shelves. Baladas owns a number of books that reveal his intellectual interests. A corner serves as storage space for everyday items like clothes, food, and dinnerware. The room is embellished with carpets and potted plants, and the luxurious bed and the ceiling height add to the impression of grandeur and wealth.

Quests

Rescue Ragash gra-Shuzgub

Arvs-Drelen's inhabitant, Baladas, is enraged by the legionnaire Ragash gra-Shuzgub's attempt to collect taxes from him. Thus, he imprisons her in a cell in his cellar, until the Nerevarine frees her in the course of the quest.

Plug-in)

Dunmer Strongholds located throughout Vvardenfell.

Then entry tunnel is guarded by an Old Key. Facing back to the south, another tunnel opening is visible in the eastern wall. This requires levitation to access.

Entering that tunnel reveals a door. Beyond the door, the tunnel curves away to the northeast and another Frost Atronach patrols here. The tunnel then curves back to the south and ends in a door that is trapped and locked (level 35), but can be opened with the Old Key obtained from the Dremora's chest.

The final area is a large cavern occupied by apparatuses.

Interior

  • The Inner Shrine is locked from the inside, it requires a key to open the doors and the key is on the body of a dead Ordinator in the cave entry area, up a ramp in the north end. To get around this trap, use a Recall, Almsivi or Divine Intervention to get out of the central shrine.
  • The Robe of St. Roris is in a hard to reach locked chest above the bells that may require levitation or extreme Acrobatics skills to get to. A rusty key found on a dreamer here opens the chest.
  • The place is pretty light on treasure otherwise, although a fair amount of Sixth House Bell Hammer, as well as twelve ash statues, and Dagoth Hlevul has his own Sixth House amulet.

Creatures

  • Dagoth Hlevul
  • Leveled Ash Creatures
  • Leveled Daedra
  • Dreamers

Control the Ordinators

Having attained the rank of House Father in Duke Vedam Dren for a couple of quests which result, ultimately, in the Nerevarine being declared Grandmaster of the House.

While advancing through the quest "Zainsubani Informant.

Bal Fell, Outer Shrine.description:
Bal Fell Map World map Local map Outer Shrine East Wing West Wing Inner Shrine Region Daedric Ruin Sublocations Bal Fell, East Wing, Bal Fell, Inner Shrine, Bal Fell, Outer Shrine, Bal Fell, West Wing Characters See below Location ID Bal Fell, Outer ShrineBal Fell, East WingBal Fell, West WingBal Fell, Inner Shrine

Bal Fell is a large Ashirbadon.

It was once a thriving settlement,[1] and, during the Sheogorath.

Outside the shrine are five Telvanni scattered around the ruins.

Inside, the first area entered is the Outer Shrine. From here, there are doors to the two roughly F-shaped wings, the East Wing and West Wing respectively. There is also a door directly to the Inner Shrine. The Inner Shrine may be entered from either wing as well.

Bal Fell, Outer Shrine

The Outer Shrine contains three Mages Guild members.

Bal Fell, East Wing

This wing contains two Daedra.

Bal Fell, West Wing

This wing contains three leveled Daedra and two members of the Mages Guild behind a barrier.

Bal Fell, Inner Shrine

Inside the Inner Shrine is a leveled Daedra and the Statue of Sheogorath. In front of the statue is a lock level 75 chest that is also trapped with poison. Inside the chest is a pair of Grand Soul Gem.

Sublocations

Shrine

The shrine section is somewhat misnamed, as the altar is in the underground section. There are two entrances from the outside on the east and west sides of this area and the third door to the north leads to the underground. There are three Dremora here.

Underground

The underground starts with an entry area similar in architecture to the Shrine level. This ends at a cavern passageway that leads to the stairs where Derar Hlervu stands beneath the statue of Molag Bal. Beneath the statue are various offerings of glass items, gems and Daedra components. Unlike many shrines, these are not cursed and they have no owner.

Quests

Molag Bal of the House of Troubles

Once the Blessings of the Third Corner from the Statue.

A Cure for Vampirism

If the Nerevarine is a Vampire and decides to get cured, this quest will involve their coming to Bal Ur and twice speaking to Molag Bal via his statue.

Balmora.description:
Balmora Destroyed Ebonheart Pact

Balmora, Stoneforest,[UL 1] or Stonewood[1] is one of the four major cities located in the Ald'ruhn.

  • 1 By game
  • 2 Description 2.1 Geography 2.2 Cuisine
  • 3 History 3.1 Second Era 3.2 Third Era 3.3 Fourth Era
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 Appearances
  • 7 References

By game

  • Stoneforest (Arena)
  • Balmora (Morrowind)
  • Balmora (Online)

Description

Geography

Balmora is located on the northern banks of the Caldera Ebony Mine in the Caldera Crater.

Within the inner walls, Balmora is divided into two, but in reality, Balmora consists of three districts. The eastern side of the river is known as Labor Town and it is where many of the residents live. People ranging from the middle class to the lower class live in Balmora, many of Balmora's criminal aspect resides in Labor Town. The area on the western shore is known as the Commercial District. The Commercial District is largely where all the business happens, the local House of Reclamations.[2]

Cuisine

  • Balmora Blue An alcoholic beverage that is banned in various provinces such as Skyrim. This concoction is made with Moon Sugar which may be the reason why it is banned since consuming too much Moon Sugar can lead to addictions.
  • Balmora Cabbage Biscuits Made with Greens and Flour. Balmora Cabbage Biscuits is an excellent meal that has received critical acclaim from places all across Morrowind.

History

Second Era

During the Ashlanders that roam Morrowind's Deadlands and prevent entrance into their modern cities. Ulvan Releth was a very kind person who had respect for the Ashlanders in the West Gash, which gave Eris some concerns that Ulvan may defect from Redoran. Eris used Captain Brivan to order a soldier to kill an Ashlander Merchant to see whether Ulvan would intervene or not. Ulvan intercepted the Soldier and killed him in haste. This caused Ulvan to be exiled from Vvardenfell, but he would go to the local Ashlanders instead.[3]

Knowing this, Brivan would use Ferhara's Warclaws to kill the Ashlanders and subsequently Ulvan. Veya grew suspicious of this and ran away from home to uncover Ulvan's disappearances. With the help of mysterious traveler, she was able to uncover Ulvan's assassination and her father's role in this. She sought vengeance against Brivan and her father, and she assassinated both of them. Her fate was unknown but regardless, Veya Releth disappeared forever.[4][5][6][7]

Since the city of Balmora is under the control of House Redoran, the Balmora region is also under the control of the Second Akaviri Invasion. Although, the Pact did not have any notable headquarters in Vvardenfell.[8]

Third Era

During the Imperial Palace. The Eternal Champion had at one point visited the town of Stoneforest in their quest to recover the pieces.[9]

In Ebonheart about the situation, to give him a reason to lower taxes.[10]

In Hortator of Hlaalu.[11][12]

Fourth Era

In 4E 201, it is unknown whether the effort reached Balmora and the city is rebuilt.[13]

Gallery

Trivia

  • A recipe for Balmora Cabbage Biscuits is available online along with the Honey Nut Treat and Sweetrolls.[UL 2]

  • The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (mentioned only)
  • The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim (mentioned only)
  • The Elder Scrolls Online (mentioned only) The Elder Scrolls Online: Morrowind

Beran Ancestral Tomb.description:
Beran Ancestral Tomb Map World map Local map Interior map Region Ancestral Tomb Location ID Beran Ancestral Tomb

Beran Ancestral Tomb is an undead and also has significantly better treasure than most.

Unique to this tomb is a Shrine of the Tribunal that is partially sunken into the final ashpit, but still functional and able to give its blessings.

There are no members of the Beran family encountered in game.

Berandas, Keep.description:
Berandas Map World map Local map Propylon Chamber Top Level Bottom Level Underground Region The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind.

  • 4 Characters

  • 6 Appearances

Sublocations

Propylon Chamber

This chamber contains two Propylons, one leading to Master Index plug-in.

Keep, Top Level

This roughly circular level has a layout typical of many Dunmer strongholds and contains a few opponents and some loot.

Keep, Bottom Level

This E-shaped level is approximately half the size of the top level and contains a few enemies.

Underground

Unlike most Dunmer strongholds, Berandas contains an underground cave level. The opponents are significantly tougher here and the final room contains the conclusion to the Boots of the Apostle quest.

Quests

  • Boots of the Apostle

  • 1 Interactions 1.1 The Hlervu Locket
  • 2 Dialogue

Interactions

The Hlervu Locket

Braynas Hlervu had to give his treasured family locket to the taxman. Bal Molagmer.

Dialogue

Hlervu Locket "I had to give my family's treasured locket to the taxman this year. The locket is now being held in Venim Manor with the rest of the taxes. I wouldn't be surprised if one of their damn guards made off with the thing himself."

After retrieving the locket:

Hlervu Locket "Is... Is that my locket?"

Sublocations

Interior

  • The main part of the fort where the majority of the residents can be found.

Prison

  • This is a two story cell block with twelve cells, three prisoners and two guards.

Towers

  • This interior area runs along the battlements, providing alternate forms of ingress to other parts of the fort.

Quests

  • Dwemer Artifacts at Drinar Varyon's Place
  • Maiden's Token
  • Rescue Joncis Dalomax
  • Shipment of Ebony
  • Sixth House Base

There are also a total of six Imperial Guards scattered in the courtyard, on the tops of the walls and in front of the gate.

Merchants

  • Arnand (potions)
  • Cocistian (Apparatus, ingredients, and potions)

  • Yambagorn (Weapons)

  • Dulian

It is a small Caldera Mine.

The town is perhaps best known for being the location of Mudcrab Merchant and significantly easier to get to. He will buy almost any item at base price.

Description

Geography

The Cavern of the Incarnate is located on the inner end of the Valley of the Wind, a dried up Sheogorad Strait had leaked into the Cavern of the Incarnate, creating pools of water around the shrine. Stalactites and stalagmites jut throughout the cavern which makes sense considering its proximity to Red Mountain. The cave is well hidden in the area and is seldom visited by pilgrims.

History

Second Era

During the Azura's Coast.[1]

Third Era

During the Teeth of the Urshilaku.[2][3]

Census and Excise Office Map Region Seyda Neen Quests See below Characters See below Location ID [?]

The Census and Excise Office is a building in Nerevarine is free to take.

  • 1 Sublocations 1.1 Census Office 1.2 Warehouse
  • 2 Quests 2.1 Death of a Taxman
  • 3 Characters
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Appearances

Sublocations

Census Office

The Census Office has 3 rooms all connected by a narrow hallway. The first room has a business desk where Socucius Ergalla resides doing his work, a shelf containing common items, and a fireplace along with Ganciele Douar guarding the door. The second room is a dining room with a table and a shelf holding various common items, and the third room is just a basement that has a bedroll to rest in, and some sacks with random loot.

Warehouse

The key to the Warehouse, which can be obtained from a shelf in the second building, grants access to the Warehouse across the street. Upon entering, two ways to go can be seen. One can go up the stairs where training is offered by Adraria Vandacia upstairs in the Warehouse. Going down the hallway will reveal that one can go up the stairs where there is some random loot, and go down the hallway to a basement room.

Quests

Death of a Taxman

Solve the mystery of a dead tax collector.

Characters

Census and Excise Warehouse.description:
The Census and Excise is an organization operated by the Empire in an attempt to manage census counting and for tax/excise purposes. Imperial taxes are based on head counts of citizens. Census and Excise is responsible for both head counts and tax assessment and collection. Census and Excise officers also administer many Imperial licenses, e.g. importation, mercenary company incorporation.

They are typically found in many major ports across an office.

Quests

  • Report to Caius Cosades
  • Death of a Taxman

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind

Sublocations

Deck

Nevosi Hlan stands on deck and a guard patrolling the harbor regularly wanders onto the ship. There is not much of interest in the ship's containers other than some moon sugar. A locked door leads to the cabin and a trapdoor on the other side down to the upper level.

Cabin

A Servant's Skull, sitting on top of a chest.

Upper level

The upper level of the ship is reached through a level 25 locked trapdoor. It serves as the main eating and sleeping area as well as doing double duty as storage space. Two guards are stationed here. Some of the items on this deck are contraband: a considerable amount of moon sugar, a skooma.

Lower level

The lower level, is accessible through a level 30 locked trapdoor from the upper level and lies in the belly of the ship. It houses some more containers with some wares and money. The five silverware plates.

Quests

Liberate the Limeware

Due to trade restrictions,[1] the glassware trader Nerevarine to steal it for her.

Council Club.description:
Each of the Holdings of a House Guard and regulating trade.[1]

  • 1 Ascension 1.1 Hortator 1.2 Grand Council 1.3 Lord High Councilor 1.4 Elder Council
  • 2 Court
  • 3 Residence and apparel
  • 4 Form of address
  • 5 Councilors 5.1 Other Councilors
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 See also
  • 8 References

Ascension

The position of Councilor given to someone who has proven their worth to the great house, the position is also hereditary, passing from parent to their first-born child, daughters apparently equal in the line of succession.[2]

Hortator

A Morrowind. In order for the position to be given, the leaders of the House must first be convinced of the need for the position.[2]

Grand Council

All of the Great Houses have seats on the Lord High Councilor is the leader of the Grand Council.[3] This council rules alongside the King of Morrowind in governing the province.[4]

Lord High Councilor

Grand Council.[3]

Elder Council

The Council Leaders of the Great Houses of Morrowind may be part of the Emperor, the Elder Council rules in the Emperor's stead.

Court

Each Councilor elects a cabinet of officials to assist them with governing their Holding:

  • Second Councilors control public relations and are often approached about business, civil disputes, and the purchasing of property, instead of approaching the Councilor directly.[5]
  • Cyrodiil counterparts.[5]
  • House Telvanni probably due to the fact that the Telvanni wizards are isolationists.[6]
  • House Guard Captains are men put in command of the House Guard, they are charged with upholding the law and defending the Holding from attack.[5]

Residence and apparel

Councilors reside in lavish palaces in the main cities of the holdings in which they govern, they convene council meetings in council houses in the house capitals.[2] There, they sit upon the throne, surrounded by their subjects. They wear lavish clothing or the armor of their house.[5][2]

Form of address

As a title, Councilors are addressed to as Councilor (Surname) i.e. "What do you say on this matter, Councilor Morvayn?" The full name is not required when addressing to a Councilor.[5]

Trivia

  • A Council is the closest form of government to a democracy in The Elder Scrolls.
  • Alternative names for the Councilor rank in the nobility structure are used in other parts of Jarls from Skyrim.
  • Councilors do not have to be Nord.[2]

Dagoth Ur Map World map Local map Outer Facility Inner Facility Inner Tower Lower Facility Facility Cavern Akulakhan's Chambers Region Voruse Bethrimo Location ID "akulakhan's chamber""dagoth ur, facility cavern""dagoth ur, inner facility""dagoth ur, inner tower""dagoth ur, lower facility""dagoth ur, outer facility"

Dagoth Ur is a main questline.

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Sublocations 2.1 Outer Facility 2.2 Inner Facility 2.3 Inner Tower 2.4 Lower Facility 2.5 Facility Cavern 2.6 Akulakhan's Chamber
  • 3 Quests 3.1 The Citadels of the Sixth House 3.2 Crosier of St. Llothis the Pious
  • 4 Notable items
  • 5 Characters
  • 6 Enemies
  • 7 Gallery
  • 8 Trivia
  • 9 Appearances
  • 10 References

Description

The ruin, consisting of six sublocations, is the headquarters of the Nerevarine must undertake during the main questline. With the exception of the Inner Tower, all of the sublocations form a linear path: the Outer Facility leads to the Inner Facility, the Inner Facility leads to the Lower Facility and so on.

The entrance is blocked by a round stone shield, which only opens once the crank on a pipe that just south of the doorway is activated.

In addition to the residents and various loot containers, there are lootable dead bodies in the Outer and Inner Facilities.

Sublocations

Outer Facility

This section is the citadel's entrance, it leads to the Inner Facility. There are only five enemies, which are three Dagoth Vaner.

Inner Facility

The Inner Facility has doors to the Inner Tower and the Lower Facility and the facility itself is a long intertwining corridor with two rooms. greater bonewalker.

Inner Tower

A small domed room, where glass armor.

Lower Facility

This area leads to the Facility Cavern and has a simple layout of three small rooms, one after the other. The ash vampires Blood Ring which can be looted from his body.

Facility Cavern

This cavern is where the first encounter with Azura's Spirit listened to.

Akulakhan's Chamber

This is a very large cavern with several levels, accessible by ledges that go around the area. Its lowest section is entirely flooded by lava. In the center of the cavern stands a giant unfinished humanoid golem, called Heart of Lorkhan is attached to its empty stomach. This is where the Nerevarine encounters Dagoth Ur for the second and final time.

Quests

The Citadels of the Sixth House

Travel to the facility on confront House Dagoth.

Crosier of St. Llothis the Pious

Retrieve the Crosier of St. Llothis beside Voruse Bethrimo's corpse at the Inner Tower.

Notable items

  • Blood Ring
  • Crosier of St. Llothis
  • Demon Longbow
  • Demon Mace
  • Heart of Lorkhan
  • Heart Ring

Trivia

  • The blocked entrance mirrors that of Arkngthand, the very first Dwemer ruin encountered as part of the main quest.
  • The door leading to Akulakhan's Chambers has an inscription on it that when translated from the Dwemeris reads, "In loving memory, Gary Noonan, Sr."[UL 1]. Gary Noonan was a senior artist on Morrowind[UL 2] and dedicated the inscription to his father.

[?]

Journal

Dissapla Mine FG_DissaplaMine
ID Journal Entry
10 Hrundi told me to go to the Dissapla Mine and do what Novor Drethan says. The Dissapla Mine is northeast of the Dunmer stronghold Falensarano, which is on the mainland west of Tel Aruhn. Quest accepted
30 Novor Drethan told me that the mine has been having problems with a pack of Nix Hounds and that one of the miners, Teres Arothan, is missing. I must find Teres Arothan or his corpse and return to Novor Drethan.
40 I agreed to try and find Teres Arothan in the Dissapla Mine.
50 Teres Arothan asked me to help guide him back to the entrance of the mine.
55 I failed to rescue Teres Arothan from the Dissapla Mines. Quest failed
70 I guided Teres Arothan back to the mine entrance.
90 Novor Drethan thanked me for rescuing Teres Arothan.
100 Hrundi thanked me for finishing the contract and gave me my pay. Quest completed
110 Hrundi was displeased that I was unable to complete my mission in the Dissapla Mines. Quest completed

Dren Plantation.description:
Dren Plantation Map Region Vaval Orethi Location ID Dren Plantation

Dren Plantation is a farm in Camonna Tong.

  • 1 Background
  • 2 Characters
  • 3 Sublocations 3.1 Doves' Shack 3.2 Dren's Villa 3.3 Guard House 3.4 Helvi's Shack 3.5 Hlevala's Shack 3.6 Rethan's Shack 3.7 Shipping House 3.8 Storage Shack 3.9 Tower Shack 3.10 Verethi and Dralor
  • 4 Quests 4.1 Hlaalu Hortator 4.2 Dealing with Orvas Dren 4.3 Writ for Navil and Ranes Ienith 4.4 The Brothers Ienith
  • 5 Notable items
  • 6 Appearances
  • 7 References

Background

Dren Plantation is a huge plantation dedicated to breed Vvardenfell, Duke Vedam Dren, is the head of the criminal and racist organisation called "Camonna Tong."

The place seems to function as temporary storage area for illegal goods, above all Storage Shack.

Characters

The following characters can be found on the grounds of the Dren Plantation. For further information about present characters see the respective sublocation's page.

  • Aebondeius Jucanis
  • Ahzini
  • Arver Rethul
  • Frinnius Posuceius
  • Hides-His-Foot
  • Hrargal the Crow
  • Manos Othreleth
  • Mavus Ules
  • Neetinei
  • Ranes Ienith
  • Vaval Orethi

Sublocations

Doves' Shack

Doces Shack is the home of Arabhi can also be found here.

Dren's Villa

Dren's Villa is the main building of the plantation and the residence of its owner Orvas Dren who can be found at the top floor. The luxurious building located to the south-east of the plantation and overlooking the whole estate holds many treasures within various Ranes Ienith, the two most faithful men under Orvas Dren's command, hide in the villa's cellar.

Guard House

The Guard House is the building where the off-duty guards may be found. It is located in the northeast of the plantation and features a balcony overlooking the estate.

Helvi's Shack

Helvi's Shack is the home of the Camonna Tong member locked containers.

Hlevala's Shack

Hlevala's Shack is the residence of the plantation's foreman Hlevala Madalvel,[1] who can be found here.

Rethan's Shack

Rethan's Shack is the home of a Battlemage called armor pieces in his hut.

Shipping House

The Shipping House is a building located closest to the small mooring area of the plantation. It stands in the shadow of the southern walls where stairs lead down to the near river.

Storage Shack

As its name states the Storage Shack is used for storing some of the plantations merchandise. The goods found here have nothing to do with the breeding of netches practiced on the plantation, though. Instead, vast amounts of the illegal substance Moon Sugar are hidden inside various containers.

Tower Shack

The Tower Shack is a small hut raised above the grounds of the plantation. Llaro Llethri resides within.

Verethi and Dralor

Verethi and Dralor serves as a comparatively roomy home for the two Ivrosa Verethi. The two can be encountered here.

Quests

Hlaalu Hortator

Become the House Hlaalu.

Dealing with Orvas Dren

Deal with the Camonna Tong.

Writ for Navil and Ranes Ienith

Execute Ranes Ienith.

The Brothers Ienith

Eliminate the two Camonna Tong enforcers Navil and Ranes Ienith.

Notable items

[?]

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
  • The Elder Scrolls Online

East Empire North Warehouse.description:
It has been suggested that this page be split into one or more multiple articles, because: This should also have pages for the faction in Morrowind/Skyrim (Discuss)

East Empire Company General information Leader(s) Imperial Legion

The East Empire Company, also known as the East Empire Trading Company[2] and abbreviated as the EEC[3] or the EETC,[4][5] is a powerful, multi-national, "monopolistic mercantilist"[6] trading company in The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon, and is also encountered in The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.

  • 1 History 1.1 Third Era 1.2 Fourth Era
  • 2 Locations
  • 3 Trade
  • 4 Influences
  • 5 Offices
  • 6 Joining the East Empire Company 6.1 Ranks
  • 7 Quests 7.1 The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind 7.1.1 Morrowind 7.2 The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon 7.2.1 Solstheim 7.3 The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim 7.3.1 Skyrim 7.4 The Elder Scrolls V: Dragonborn 7.4.1 Solstheim
  • 8 Members 8.1 The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind 8.1.1 Morrowind 8.2 The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon 8.2.1 Solstheim 8.3 The Elder Scrolls V: Dragonborn 8.3.1 Solstheim 8.4 The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim 8.4.1 Skyrim
  • 9 Trivia
  • 10 Appearances
  • 11 References

History

Third Era

When exactly the East Empire Company was founded is unknown, but it first appeared in 3E 134.[3]

In the year Caldera being noteworthy locations.[7][8][9]

They also sought to expand to Fort Frostmoth.[12] Though many Imperial soldiers died, the Nords were unsuccesful in claiming the island.[12] It is unknown if the wealth of Raven Rock played a part in this.

When the Oblivion Crisis did take place, it was said that Raven Rock was spared most of its damage due to there being no record of Oblivion Gates on Solstheim. As a result, everyone was still going to work as they had done the years before.[10] What happened to the guard force stationed on Solstheim is contradicted. While Elder Council said that he had been pleading for troops for Cyrodiil for weeks, but was not granted them due to the Imperial army already being fully committed in the other provinces.[13] Ocato also did not want to risk the other provinces becoming upset and resulting in a full-scale political crisis by him recalling the Legions.[13]

Fourth Era

After the Oblivion Crisis had ended and the Vittoria Vici if the Company wanted to buy his business on Raven Rock, but was declined due to the Company not seeing any financial advantage to setting up business on the island of Solstheim.[3]

In Skyrim, the Windhelm, but Solitude regained its trade,[20] Windhelm would now be used for paperwork.[20]

Locations

The East Empire trading company has holdings in many eastern territories of the Emperor of Tamriel, whose Legions also protect it.[23]

Trade

The East Empire Company controls the trade of Dwemer artifacts illegal.[24] Those under the employ of the Company can get certificates which are worth a number of gold.[25] These certificates can be used to pay off bounties.[26]

Influences

Many senior ranking officers in the company are seen as corrupt and are resented by some people in the provinces, who see the businessmen as Caldera, compete over ebony business.[27]

Offices

The East Empire Company has offices in Waterfront District of the city.

Every company chapter is headed by a Factor who directs and controls the affairs of the company in his or her region.[28][29] As a high-ranking official of the company, they have the right to construct an estate on the company premises, such as the large Factor Estate adjacent to the company's ebonymine inside of Raven Rock.[30]

Joining the East Empire Company

During the events of Carnius Magius and rise in their ranks to complete quests.

Ranks

Rank Required Attributes Required Skills
0. Underling Willpower 30
1. Clerk Personality 30, Willpower 30 One skill at 10
2. Steward Personality 30, Willpower 30 One skill at 20
3. Fixer Personality 30, Willpower 30 One skill at 30, two at 5
4. Agent Personality 30, Willpower 30 One skill at 40, two at 10
5. Negotiator Personality 31, Willpower 31 One skill at 50 two at 15
6. Officer Personality 32, Willpower 32 One skill at 60, two at 20
7. Deputy Personality 33, Willpower 33 One skill at 70, two at 25
8. Factor Personality 35, Willpower 35 One skill at 90, two at 35

Trivia

  • Because the EEC was added as a faction by Vvardenfell, are not integrated into the faction.
  • The East Empire Trading Company shares many similarities with the real-life British and Dutch East India Companies. Like its in-game counterpart, both companies enjoyed legal monopolies on trade with the Americas and the East Indies, which were granted by the government. Both companies also enjoyed being in favor with the reigning authorities (the monarch in Britain's case and the Stadholder in the Netherland's case), which greatly aided their operations abroad. Further similarity is seen in the endemic corruption and undue political influence wielded by the East Empire Trading Company, something which both the British and Dutch companies were infamous for.
  • After the quest for re-opening the company is completed, Hold Guards will sometimes thank the player and say that they are going to have the company import them "some Aged Breton Cheese."
  • Despite being a strong economic power, and granting the Empire part of their income, the Empire finances, and protects, the Company. The Emperor also elects the board of leading figures of the Company.

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon
  • The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim The Elder Scrolls V: Dragonborn

East Empire South Warehouse.description:
It has been suggested that this page be split into one or more multiple articles, because: This should also have pages for the faction in Morrowind/Skyrim (Discuss)

East Empire Company General information Leader(s) Imperial Legion

The East Empire Company, also known as the East Empire Trading Company[2] and abbreviated as the EEC[3] or the EETC,[4][5] is a powerful, multi-national, "monopolistic mercantilist"[6] trading company in The Elder Scrolls III: Bloodmoon, and is also encountered in The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.

History

Third Era

When exactly the East Empire Company was founded is unknown, but it first appeared in 3E 134.[3]

In the year Caldera being noteworthy locations.[7][8][9]

They also sought to expand to Fort Frostmoth.[12] Though many Imperial soldiers died, the Nords were unsuccesful in claiming the island.[12] It is unknown if the wealth of Raven Rock played a part in this.

When the Oblivion Crisis did take place, it was said that Raven Rock was spared most of its damage due to there being no record of Oblivion Gates on Solstheim. As a result, everyone was still going to work as they had done the years before.[10] What happened to the guard force stationed on Solstheim is contradicted. While Elder Council said that he had been pleading for troops for Cyrodiil for weeks, but was not granted them due to the Imperial army already being fully committed in the other provinces.[13] Ocato also did not want to risk the other provinces becoming upset and resulting in a full-scale political crisis by him recalling the Legions.[13]

Fourth Era

After the Oblivion Crisis had ended and the Vittoria Vici if the Company wanted to buy his business on Raven Rock, but was declined due to the Company not seeing any financial advantage to setting up business on the island of Solstheim.[3]

In Skyrim, the Windhelm, but Solitude regained its trade,[20] Windhelm would now be used for paperwork.[20]

Locations

The East Empire trading company has holdings in many eastern territories of the Emperor of Tamriel, whose Legions also protect it.[23]

Trade

The East Empire Company controls the trade of Dwemer artifacts illegal.[24] Those under the employ of the Company can get certificates which are worth a number of gold.[25] These certificates can be used to pay off bounties.[26]

Influences

Many senior ranking officers in the company are seen as corrupt and are resented by some people in the provinces, who see the businessmen as Caldera, compete over ebony business.[27]

Offices

The East Empire Company has offices in Waterfront District of the city.

Every company chapter is headed by a Factor who directs and controls the affairs of the company in his or her region.[28][29] As a high-ranking official of the company, they have the right to construct an estate on the company premises, such as the large Factor Estate adjacent to the company's ebonymine inside of Raven Rock.[30]

Joining the East Empire Company

During the events of Carnius Magius and rise in their ranks to complete quests.

Ebonheart Destroyed Battle of Ebonheart (Ebonheart Pact

Ebonheart, the Black City, or the One True Ebonheart[1] is one of the eight major cities within the province of Moraelyn.

  • 1 By game
  • 2 Description 2.1 Geography 2.2 Traditions
  • 3 History 3.1 First Era 3.1.1 The Dunmer of House Ra'athim & Modern-Ebonheart 3.2 Second Era 3.2.1 The Second Akaviri Invasion & the Ebonheart Pact 3.2.2 Treason within Ebonheart & the Dres Occupation of Ebonheart 3.2.3 Vivec's Fateful Visit to Ebonheart 3.3 Third Era 3.3.1 The Rise of Katariah Ra'athim & Pelagius the Mad 3.3.2 The Staff of Chaos & Dagoth-Ur
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Trivia
  • 6 Appearances
  • 7 References

By game

  • Ebonheart (Arena)
  • Ebonheart (Online)

Description

Geography

The city of Ebonheart sits on an island along the southern shores of the Fighters Guild tends to sent up camp near the Inn.

The western end of town is where many of the residents live as well as several House nobles. The local temple resides in the west wing as well, for the longest time, the temple was built to worship the Hist Sapling in the center of town. The Ebonheart Outskirts in the south is where the local militia gathers, as well as refugees of war, or foreigners.

The location of the Tear. Sources have stated that the location of the compound is somewhere underneath the town of Ebonheart.[2]

Traditions

Ebonheart only click to show
The Evening Star. It is a day of rest, where many leave the events of the passing year behind and to reflect their past. They rest for the New Life Festival.[4]
Morrowind in general Click to show
This list is incomplete; help us expand it. The Vivec, being dubbed Saint Jiub the Eradicator.[5][6] [?]

History

First Era

The Dunmer of House Ra'athim & Modern-Ebonheart

The city-state of Ebonheart has been a city of Staff of Chaos, as it was S'ephen's birthplace. The rivalry between the two city-states had grown.[7][8]

Second Era

The Second Akaviri Invasion & the Ebonheart Pact

In Black Marsh. The name of the alliance came from the city it was founded in, Ebonheart.[9][10][11]

Treason within Ebonheart & the Dres Occupation of Ebonheart

During the Vestige to bring the people together in their time of need.[12]

With the help of the Vestige, the denizens of Ebonheart came together to join the Ebonheart Pact in their battle against the Daggerfall Covenant. A Dunmer man named Rhavil Urano was conducting the disagreements with the townsfolk, and he was acting suspiciously throughout the city. Othral tasked the Vestige to investigate his recent activities to see a connection between him and the Covenant Armada. Urano went to a shack on the Ebonheart Dockyards and left several minutes later. The Vestige uncovered a magical book and an apparition of a Covenant Officer. Urano was working with the Covenant and brought them to Ebonheart through messages. The information leaked and the Urano was killed by the Vestige.[12]

Vivec's Fateful Visit to Ebonheart

In Ebonheart on Vvardenfell.[13]

Third Era

The Rise of Katariah Ra'athim & Pelagius the Mad

During his reign as the Kynareth.[14]

The Staff of Chaos & Dagoth-Ur

During the Imperial Palace. The Eternal Champion had at one point visited the city of Ebonheart in their quest to recover the pieces. The city of Ebonheart was under the rule of King Casik.[15]

The Eternal Champion reached the city of Ebonheart on their quest to find the final piece of the Staff. Residents told the Champion to visit King Casik, to see if he knew of the location. The Champion arrived into Casik's domain, and the King gave him a proposition. The King asked that the Champion retrieves the Hammer of Gharen, and he would give the location of the piece. The warrior traveled to Imperial City to confront Jagar Tharn.[16][17]

Gallery

Trivia

  • In an earlier stage of development, Arena was going to be a tournament-based game, where each city had their own gladiatorial team. Ebonheart's team was known as the Reavers.[UL 1]

Description

It is a large canton located in races, and creeds can be found.

Background

The Foreign Quarter was formerly the only canton that outlanders could visit. Local law was amended to allow travelers access to the entire City. Located in the northern part of the cantons in Vivec, it is a large structure the size of a small town, which houses an extra level, it is the only canton in the city to do so. The canton itself can be separated into six different sub locations:

Foreign Quarter Plaza

Vivec's Fighters Guild

When first entering the plaza, two buildings on each side can be seen, and several inside, everything is owned.

Vivec's Mages Guild

Inside the Sirilonwe can be found. Inside, on a table, there is a small locked chest, also within are two small locked chests, and Sirilonwe's personal chest.

Foreign Quarter Plaza

On the main plaza, armor trading services.

Characters

The following characters can be found in this location:

  • Alusaron (Male Redguard)
  • Orsimer)
  • Bosmer)
  • Chalone (Female Redguard)
  • Imperial)
  • Domalen (Male Redguard)
  • Dumner)
  • Favise Selaren (Female Dunmer)
  • Flacassia Fauseius (Female Imperial)
  • Breton)
  • Lorbumol gro-Aglakh (Male Orsimer)
  • Malven Romori (Female Dunmer)
  • Ordinators (Male Dunmer)
  • Raig (Male Redguard)
  • Ralen Tilvur (Male Dunmer)
  • Altmer)
  • Nord)
  • Tiram Gadar (Male Dunmer)
  • Trebonius Artorius (Male Imperial)
  • Khatjiit)

Foreign Quarter Lower Waistworks

In the Lower Waistworks, there are several doors leading to the Upper Waistworks, the Canalworks, or back to Vivec. Down a hall there are merchant shops, the first one is the alchemist services of miscellaneous items.

Characters

The following characters can be found in this location:

  • Andilu Drothan (Female Dunmer)
  • Aurane Frernis (Female Breton)
  • Aradraen (Female Bosmer)
  • Ethys Savil (Male Dunmer)
  • Favel Gobor (Male Dunmer)
  • Felvos Droryn (Male Dunmer)
  • Argonian)
  • Hylf the Harrier (Male Nord)
  • Jobasha (Male Khajiit)
  • Marcel Maurard (Male Breton)
  • Miun-Gei (Male Argonian)
  • Ordinators (Male Dunmer)
  • Raril Giral (Male Dunmer)
  • Seryn Othralen (Female Dunmer)
  • Sevyni Saryon (Male Dunmer)
  • Urven Davor(Male Dunmer)

Foreign Quarter Upper Waistworks

On the top level of the Upper Waistworks, there are three merchants, each selling various items. All three of them, have locked chests. Next to Apprentice Alembic. There are only two ways in or out of this location, through the Lower Waistworks, or from outside.

Characters

The following characters can be found in this location:

  • Baissa (Female Khajiit)
  • Idonea Munia (Female Imperial)
  • Ordinators (Male Dunmer)
  • Rolasa Oren (Female Dunmer)

Foreign Quarter Canalworks

There are two different sections of the Canalworks, that can be reached, from the Lower Waistworks, through the Tomb, or from the Underworks. There will be trap doors leading to the Underworks, and doors leading to the Tomb. The tomb contains several Thieves Guild members can be found, as well as two locked chests.

Characters

The following characters can be found in this location:

  • Agrippina Herennia (Female Imperial)
  • Crazy-Legs Arantamo (Male Dunmer)
  • Gentleman Jim Stacey (Male Redguard)
  • Jeanne (Female Redguard)
  • J'Rasha (Male Khajitt)
  • Letreius Muco (Male Imperial)
  • Ordinators (Male Dunmer)
  • Simine Fralinie (Male Breton)

Foreign Quarter Underworks

Inside the Underworks, that serve as sewers to the whole canton. Malacath. Inside two of his associates are guarding the shrine, these are hostile towards the Nerevarine.

Characters and creatures

The following characters and creatures can be found in this location:

  • Azuk gro-Rugob (Male Orismer)
  • A Dremora Lord
  • Dreamer Prophet (Female Dunmer)
  • Garzonk gro-Mulakh (Male Orsimer)
  • Murkub gro-Ushul (Male Orsimer)
  • Rats

Foreign Quarter Tomb

Within the tomb, there are several leveled undead and rats. In the first room there is a door, which houses a small bowl containing . Further inside the tomb, there is a locked chest at the top of some stairs.

Creatures

The following creatures may be found in this location:

  • Ancestor Ghosts
  • Skeletons
  • Bonelords
  • Rats

Quests

Click to show

Mysterious Killings in Vivec Locate and kill the Dreamer Prophet, in the Vivec Foreign Quarter Underworks.

Fort Pelagiad.description:
Fort Pelagiad Map Region Free New-Shoes Bragor Characters 5 (see article) Location ID "Pelagiad, Fort Pelagiad""Pelagiad, North Wall""Pelagiad, South Wall"

Fort Pelagiad is an Angoril oversees the day-to-day operations of the fort.

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Sublocations
  • 3 Characters
  • 4 Services 4.1 Blessings 4.2 Merchants 4.3 Skill Trainer 4.4 Smith 4.5 Spell Merchant

Description

Imperial Legion Guards and Archers patrol the fort's courtyard and walls. There are numerous entrances via the north wall, south wall, and fort proper. The fort contains three floors, not including the walls and the top of the towers (all four towers can be climbed from within for a scenic view of the area surrounding the fort).

Angoril can be found on the upper level of the fort offering melee training to Legion members. He says that it is quiet at Fort Pelagiad, and suggests that the Security to pick) and a locked closet (12). Angoril also carries a key to the fort's prison that unlocks the cell doors.

An Imperial Guard Captain can be found on the ground floor, along with the fort's smith, spell merchant. There is a locked chest requiring 75 Security to pick near Ygfa.

At the bottom of the staircase is a door leading directly to the prison and barracks area under the south wall, requiring 95 Security or the prison key to unlock. Using this particular door is unnecessary, as all the other south wall doors are unlocked. The prison contains Fort Pelagiad Prisoner Log can be found on a table in the barracks, along with 4 locked chests requiring 25 Security to open.

Sublocations

  • North Wall A lone guard and a few crates may be found here, otherwise there is nothing of interest in this area of the fort.
  • South Wall The fort's prison and barracks are located in this area of the fort.

Characters

Along with Imperial Archers, Guards, and a Guard Captain, the following characters can be found at this location:

  • Angoril Master-at-Arms
  • New-Shoes Bragor Prisoner
  • Morbash gro-Shagdub Prisoner
  • Shadbak gra-Burbug Smith
  • Ygfa Healer

Ghostgate, Tower of Dawn.description:
Ghostgate Map Region The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind. It is a large building, part of a giant wall.
  • 1 Description
  • 2 Shrine of Pride
  • 3 Sublocations 3.1 Ghostgate Temple 3.1.1 Ghostgate Temple shrines 3.2 Tower of Dawn 3.3 Tower of Dawn Lower Level 3.4 Tower of Dusk 3.5 Tower of Dusk Lower Level

  • 6 Notable items 6.1 Armor 6.2 Weapons 6.3 Books 6.4 Other

Description

The Ghostgate provides the only ground entrance in and out of the Buoyant Armigers who are stationed here.

Outside, on the Tunipy Shamirbasour can be found.

Shrine of Pride

The Ghostgate is often used as a base for the pilgrims who wish to reach the nearby Ghostgate Shrine Blessing.

Sublocations

Ghostgate Temple

It houses Uvoo Llaren, a Priest and a Monk, respectively. The temple is made of a main room, where many shrines can be found.

Ghostgate Temple shrines

The shrines have several effects to chose from:

  • Cure Disease
  • Cure Blight
  • Cure Poison

In addition to these, they all have a unique effect:

  • Shrine of St. Personality by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Blight Disease by 10%.
  • Shrine of St. Restoration by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Willpower by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Corprus Disease by 20%.
  • Shrine of St. Fatigue by 20 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Common Disease by 20%.
  • Shrine of St. Endurance by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Health by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Poison by 20%.
  • Shrine of St. Attributes by 100 points.
  • Shrine of fortifies Attack by 5 points.

Tower of Dawn

It is one of the two main sections of the Ghostgate. It houses Ulmiso Maloren. There is also a room for rent.

Tower of Dawn Lower Level

It is a living area, there is a locked room at the back where a guard is located, an can be found also.

Tower of Dusk

It is the other main section of the building, there is a Fonas Retheran.

Tower of Dusk Lower Level

It is a living quarter, and as in the previous tower, the locked room contains the unique .

Quests

  • Auriel's Bow
  • Courtesy
  • Cure the Outcast Outlander
  • Enamor
  • Cleaver of St. Felms
  • Crosier of St. Llothis the Pious
  • Cure the Outcast Outlander
  • Food and Drink for the Hermit
  • Hair Shirt of St. Aralor
  • Pilgrimages of the Seven Graces
  • A Lucky Coin
  • Viatrix, The Annoying Pilgrim

Characters

Gallery

  • There is another relatively hidden passage through the ghostfence, into the Nabith Waterway.
  • The Ghostgate had not been built by the time of the Planemeld.

Gnisis.description:
Gnisis Destroyed Ald'ruhn.
  • 1 By game
  • 2 Description 2.1 Geography
  • 3 History 3.1 Second Era 3.2 Third Era 3.3 Fourth Era
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Appearances
  • 6 References

By game

  • Gnisis (Morrowind)
  • Gnisis (Online)

Description

Geography

Gnisis is the biggest settlement found in northwestern Vvardenfell where the smaller settlements are simple fishing villages such as Fort Darius is a stronghold built on the eastern side of town and it leads to the rest of the West Gash.

History

Second Era

During the Vestige was able to bring a new queen to the nest and brought work back to the mine.[1][2]

Third Era

In Arvs-Drelen at the time. After meeting with Baladas, the Nerevarine became Hortator of House Telvanni and eventually defeat Dagoth Ur.[3]

Sometime prior, Uriel Septim VII who was visiting Vvardenfell at the time. They were stopped by the Nerevarine, and Uriel was able to live another day.[4]

Fourth Era

Gnisis along with many other settlements in Vvardenfell were destroyed when Neria Relethyl who went to Blacklight. A House Redoran Councilman established a relief effort to rebuild the cities and towns in Vvardenfell; this included Gnisis. It is unknown whether Gnisis is fully complete or not.[5][6]

Gallery

Governor's Hall.description:
Governor's Hall Map City map Interior map Region Caldera Quests See Quests Characters See Characters Location ID Caldera, Governor's Hall

The Governor's Hall is a large residence belonging to House Hlaalu and it is home to a number of service providers.

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Quests 2.1 Books for Vala 2.2 Donation from Cunius Pelelius 2.3 Erroneous Documents 2.4 Rent and Taxes 2.5 Sealed Orders 2.6 Shipment of Ebony 2.7 Shut the Mines Down 2.8 The Caldera Spy
  • 3 Notable items
  • 4 Characters
  • 5 Services
  • 6 Appearances

Description

Through an archway at the top of the exterior stairs there are three doors leading inside. A desk greets visitors who enter through the main door and Llaros Uvayn, wander the ground floor offering their services for a fee.

The two spiral staircases nearest the entrance on the east and west sides of the building lead to a second-floor hallway connecting two towers. Olumba gro-Boglar wanders the hall, otherwise there is nothing of interest here. The staircases continue up to the tower summits, but are void of people, items, and doors.

The two spiral staircases furthest from the entrance lead to a private area of the second floor, consisting of two rooms that serve as clothing. Other than Odral himself, there is little of interest here.

The western room contains another bed, Odral's closet and his chest. The closet is locked (level 65) and contains an ledger revealing details of underhanded activities at the mines is also found within.

The central staircase is not connected to the building's second floor. At the summit there are a number of barrels, baskets, and crates containing a variety of items, including a couple of steel armor.

Quests

Books for Vala

Vala Catraso.

Donation from Cunius Pelelius

evidence of corruption found at Governor's Hall.

Erroneous Documents

Odral Helvi would like the Nerevarine to travel to the Vivec City with a "corrected" land deed, and quietly swap it with the original.

Rent and Taxes

Odral instructs Nerevarine to collect fifty drakes owed by two farmers in the disposition while slaying the farmers results in an increase.

Sealed Orders

Odral has some head of the treasury.

Shipment of Ebony

Odral instructs the Nerevarine to deliver five pieces of Drinar Varyon, a known smuggler. Odral says that, "He will deliver them to... friends of mine on the mainland."

Shut the Mines Down

Mining Company Office.

The Caldera Spy

Odral requests that the Nerevarine recover contracts stolen from the Caldera mine, and kill whoever is responsible for the theft. Once discovering the thief's identity, the Nerevarine can convince her to hand over the documents peacefully, or execute her.

Notable items

  • Amulet of Mighty Blows
  • Odral's History of the Empire 1
  • Odral's History of the Empire 2
  • Odral's History of the Empire 3
  • Odral's History of the Empire 4
  • Secret Caldera Ledger

Grand Council Chambers Tower.description:
Castle Ebonheart Map Region Imperial Cult on Vvardenfell.
  • 1 Sublocations 1.1 Grand Council Chambers 1.2 Grand Council Chambers Tower 1.3 Imperial Chapel 1.4 Imperial Commission 1.5 Imperial Guard Garrison
  • 2 Quests 2.1 Imperial Cult 2.2 Tribunal main quest 2.2.1 Hunt the Dark Brotherhood 2.3 Miscellaneous 2.3.1 Dredil's Delivery
  • 3 Characters
  • 4 Appearances

Sublocations

Grand Council Chambers

These are the main rooms of the castle, where the Nerevarine can encounter several important personalities, including Varus Vantinius in an upper chamber that can be reached through an spiral staircase.

Grand Council Chambers Tower

The Grand Council Chambers Tower is a small location which can be reached from the Grand Council Chambers. The tower seems to serve as an arsenal, as it contains various armour and weapons at on top of the spiral staircase. The Matus Mido resides here.

Imperial Chapel

The Imperial Chapel consists of an upper room which serves sacred space with an Synnolian Tunifus. Lalatia Varian is the highest ranking priest.

Imperial Commission

The Imperial Commission can be reached through a door out of the entrance room of Grand Council Chambers. Duke's Guards reside here. It seems to contain the private quarters of a person of notable importance and wealth, possibly the Duke's himself. A door leads to the Imperial Guard Garrison.

Imperial Guard Garrison

The Imperial Guard Garrison can only be reached from the Imperial Commission. It serves as home for many Imperial soldiers. The rooms of the soldiers are on the lower floor. On the upper floor is a habitable room, where the soldiers can meet, eat and drink. Apart from the soldiers Viccia Claevius, reside in the garrison.

Quests

Imperial Cult

Tribunal main quest

Hunt the Dark Brotherhood

Asciene Rane teleports the Nerevarine to the mainland of Morrowind.

Miscellaneous

Dredil's Delivery

Llaalam Dredil in the Grand Council Chambers asks the Nerevarine to deliver a letter to J'Zhirr.

Description

It is part of the Tholer Saryoni, can be found in there.

The shrines

Inside the High Fane, twelve different shrines can be found in the central room. All shrines can be used to Cure Poison. They also, all have a unique temporary effect:

  • Shrine of St. Personality by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Blight Disease by 10%.
  • Shrine of St. Restoration by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Willpower by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Corprus Disease by 20%.
  • Shrine of St. Fatigue by 20 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Common Disease by 20%.
  • Shrine of St. Endurance by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Health by 5 points.
  • Shrine of St. Resist Poison by 20%.
  • Shrine of St. Attributes by 100 points.

Hla Oad.description:
Hla Oad Map Region Bitter Coast. Hla Oad is unique in that there are no direct routes to it, and the most convenient way to travel there is by boat. There are very few quests to complete there, as it is a small village.
  • 1 Description
  • 2 Locations
  • 3 Quests
  • 4 Characters
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Appearances

Description

There are not many shops or inns in this small port town. A few small fisher huts and several beggars' huts are centered around a main square. Trasteve, who has a few weapons, armor, arrows, potions, and several other items for sale.

Sparse in legal trade, Hla Oad is home to a thriving underworld hidden beneath the village and accessed through a trapdoor from Fatleg's Drop Off. There, the Llemisa Marys sells lockpicks and probes. Perien Aurielie is Hla Oad's pawnbroker and is also an agent of the Camonna Tong.

Holamayan Monastery.description:
Holamayan Monastery Destroyed Dissident Priests

The Holamayan Monastery or Holamayan is a temple located along Apographa, an ancient text that is hidden from the populous.

  • 1 By game
  • 2 Description 2.1 Geography
  • 3 History 3.1 First Era 3.2 Second Era 3.3 Third Era 3.4 Fourth Era
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Appearances
  • 6 References

By game

  • Holamayan Monastery (Morrowind)
  • Holamayan Monastery (Online)

Description

Geography

The Island of Holamayan is located on the southeastern end of Azura's Coast, towards the Tribunal Temple.

History

First Era

During the first era, Kagrenac's Tools to take the Dwarves immortality, and the Tribunal betrayed Indoril Nerevar to achieve godhood.[1]

Second Era

During the Nerevarine Prophecy, they had begun to partake in heavy research and study on the overall topic. To protect themselves, the Dissident Priests created a magical barrier surrounding Holamayan Monastery, which will open up during the dawn and dusk, since these times are linked with Azura, the Patron of the Temple. Holamayan remained closed from the rest of Vvardenfell for quite sometime and the Dissident Priests have remained in hiding.[2][3]

Third Era

During the outbreak of Nerevarine.[4][5]

Fourth Era

During the Great House, when the Temple priesthood and House Indoril were considered one of the same. Political Power would then fall onto the Temple Priests, yet the old high-ranking members of House Indoril remained in their high-status. It is unknown whatever happened to Holamayan Monastery, but it was either left abandoned, or it was repaired by the relief effort on Vvardenfell.[6][7]

Gallery

Appearances

  • The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
  • The Elder Scrolls Online: Morrowind

Huleen's Hut.description:
Huleen's Hut Quest Giver Mages Guild Quest Quest ID MG_Apprentice

Huleen's Hut is a Ald'ruhn.

  • 1 Objectives
  • 2 Walkthrough
  • 3 Reward
  • 4 Journal
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Appearances

Objectives

  • Head to Maar Gan
  • Head south east from the town to reach the Hut
  • Kill the scamp inside
  • Talk to Huleen's apprentice
  • Return to the guild

Walkthrough

There have been some disturbances at Huleen's hut. The assignment is to find out what they were. Travel to Maar Gan and talk to the guards for directions to Huleen's hut. They will say it is Southeast of town.

Head to the hut and a scamp will attack. Kill the scamp and take the key from its corpse. Head downstairs and unlock the cupboard door either using the key the scamp had, the key in the next to the common robes on the floor, or pick the lock. Huleen's naked apprentice will be found inside who will explain that he was trying to be a powerful wizard and prove he's good at conjuration.

Return to Ald'ruhn to complete the quest.

Reward

  • 250
  • 2 Scrolls of the Fifth Barrier

Journal

Huleen's Hut
Edwinna told me that there has been some sort of disturbance at Huleen's hut in Maar Gan. I am supposed to investigate and put a stop to the disturbance. Quest accepted
Edwinna was curious about what a Scamp was doing in Huleen's hut. She wants me to return to the hut and look for Huleen's apprentice, Listien Bierles.
I spoke with Listien Bierles, Huleen's apprentice. He apparently summoned a Scamp and then lost control of it. Everything seems to be under control now.
I put a stop to the disturbance at Huleen's Hut. Now Edwinna can get back to her studies. Quest complete I told Edwinna that I killed Huleen's apprentice. She expelled me from the Mages Guild. Quest complete
